meanings.definition: Unconventional and slightly disreputable in an attractive way.
meanings.sent1: The man's raffish appearance turned heads at the party.
meanings.sent2: She admired his raffish charm and carefree attitude.
meanings.sent3: Despite his raffish style, he always knew how to make people smile.
meanings.sent4: His raffish demeanor was like a colorful painting in a room of black and white.
meanings.sent5: The raffish pirate captain left a lasting impression on everyone he met.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or belonging to the lower classes.
meanings.sent1: The old car had a raffish look that reminded him of his childhood neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The worn-out furniture gave the room a raffish feel.
meanings.sent3: The raffish street vendor always had the best stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: Her raffish accent hinted at her humble origins.
meanings.sent5: The raffish graffiti on the wall added a touch of rebellion to the street.
